t: For the director of music. With stringed instruments. A psalm of Asaph. A song.
God*pn is renowned in Judah; in*ld Israel his name is great.
His*ln tent is in Salem, his*ld dwelling place in Zion.
There*ln he broke the flashing arrows, the*ld shields and the swords, the weapons of war.
You*pn are radiant with light, more*ld majestic than mountains rich with game.
The*ln valiant lie plundered, they*ld sleep their last sleep; not*ln one of the warriors can*ld lift his hands.
At*ln your rebuke, God of Jacob, both*ld horse and chariot lie still.
It*pn is you alone who are to be feared. Who*ld can stand before you when you are angry?
From*ln heaven you pronounced judgment, and*ld the land feared and was quietâ€”
when*ln you, God, rose up to judge, to*ld save all the afflicted of the land.
Surely*ln your wrath against mankind brings you praise, and*ld the survivors of your wrath are restrained.
Make*pn vows to the Lord*s your God and fulfill them; let*ld all the neighboring lands bring*ld gifts to the One to be feared.
He*ln breaks the spirit of rulers; he*ld is feared by the kings of the earth.
